title: Partial disclosure of report activity through new "Export as .zip" feature
content:
Hello Team,
I noticed a new feature has been launched, which allows to export report. Great feature.
But unfortunately it discloses comments of partially disclosed reports which supposed to be hidden..
POC:
Go to this partially disclosed report > https://hackerone.com/reports/██████████
Click Export Button.
You'll see comments are getting disclosed!
{F134909}
This way you can see all the partially disclosed reports comments.
Please let me know if you need more information!
Looking forward!
steps: Navigate to a partially disclosed report on HackerOne: https://hackerone.com/reports/██████████
Click the 'Export as .zip' button to export the report
vuln_description: The 'Export as .zip' feature in HackerOne inadvertently discloses comments from partially disclosed reports, which are supposed to remain hidden. This allows unauthorized users to view sensitive information that should not be accessible.
reason: The vulnerability is straightforward to discover as it involves a single action (exporting the report) and does not require any complex interactions or understanding of multiple components. The issue is a simple oversight in the export functionality.
